meanings.definition: Tending to bounce or capable of bouncing.
meanings.sent1: The rubber ball was very bouncy.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's bouncy nature made everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The bouncy ball seemed to have a mind of its own, bouncing all over the room.
meanings.sent4: Her bouncy curls framed her face like a halo.
meanings.sent5: The trampoline was so bouncy, it felt like jumping on a cloud.

meanings.sent1: The children were bouncy after eating sugary treats.
meanings.sent2: She had a bouncy personality that lit up the room.
meanings.sent3: His bouncy attitude was contagious, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The bouncy music at the party kept everyone dancing all night.
meanings.sent5: The bouncy cheerleader led the crowd in spirited chants.

meanings.sent1: The bouncy rubber band snapped back into place.
meanings.sent2: The mattress was so bouncy, it felt like sleeping on a cloud.
meanings.sent3: The bouncy ball bounced back even higher than before when thrown against the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her bouncy step showed her resilience in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The bouncy material of the trampoline provided a soft landing for the jumpers.
